section.title: Pre-Install Requirements and Prerequisites
section.para: Ensure that the following requirements have been met before continuing with the installation.

section.title: Hardware Requirements
section.para: The Example doesn't change the &THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE Hardware Requirements. Refer to &THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE documentation for more information.

section.title: Software Prerequisites
section.para: The example in this user guide requires that &THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE is properly set. In case you are using separated JVMs to host the Java EE and JAIN SLEE applications, the &THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE Remote SLEE Connection Tool must be deployed in the Java EE server. The remote connection tool must be properly configured so that it can interact with the remote JAIN SLEE container.

important.para: Maven 2.0.9 (or higher) is used to build the release. Instructions for using Maven2, including install, can be found at

note.para: You must use Maven to build the binary.

section.title: Installing &THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE &THIS.EXAMPLE; Example
section.para: Installing the example requires that you copy the JMX Client -bean directory to the deploy directory of the JBoss AS5, and the JAIN SLEE deployable unit to the deploy directory of the JAIN SLEE container.

section.title: Uninstalling &THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE &THIS.EXAMPLE; Example
section.para: To uninstall simply delete the JMX Client -bean directory and JAIN SLEE deployable unit jar created in the install phase.

section.title: Configuring the Java EE server to interact with a remote JAIN SLEE
section.para: You must configure and deploy the &THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE Remote SLEE Connection Tool in the Java EE server. Please refer to the Java EE server User Guide for instructions on how to install and configure the remote connection tool.
